content.introduction: This chapter introduces students to the beauty of nature and the world around us through descriptive poems and stories.

topics.title: Reading and Comprehension
topics.description: Understanding the theme and message of the poem. Learning to appreciate descriptive language and imagery.
examples: Identify the main characters in the story
Find descriptive words used for nature
Explain the moral of the story

topics.title: Vocabulary Building
topics.description: Learning new words related to nature, emotions, and daily life.
examples: Wonderful - extremely good or beautiful
Magnificent - impressive in appearance
Spectacular - beautiful in a dramatic way

exercises: Read the poem and answer the questions
Write five sentences about your favorite season
Match the words with their meanings
Fill in the blanks with appropriate words

content.introduction: A story that teaches the importance of working together and helping each other.

topics.title: Story Elements
topics.description: Understanding characters, setting, and plot in a story.
examples: Main characters and their roles
The problem faced by characters
How teamwork solved the problem

exercises: Answer questions based on the story
Write about a time when you worked in a team
Circle the correct answer

content.introduction: Understanding and working with numbers up to lakhs and crores. Learning to read, write, and compare large numbers.

topics.title: Place Value
topics.description: Understanding the position of digits in large numbers - ones, tens, hundreds, thousands, lakhs, and crores.
examples: In 45,678: 4 is in ten thousands place
In 2,34,567: 2 is in lakhs place
In 1,23,45,678: 1 is in crores place

topics.title: Reading and Writing Numbers
topics.description: Converting numbers from figures to words and vice versa.
examples: 5,67,890 = Five lakh sixty-seven thousand eight hundred ninety
12,00,000 = Twelve lakh
1,50,00,000 = One crore fifty lakh

topics.title: Comparing Numbers
topics.description: Using greater than (>), less than (<), and equal to (=) signs to compare large numbers.

exercises: Write the place value of underlined digits
Write the following numbers in words: 8,56,789; 12,45,000
Arrange in ascending order: 5,67,890; 5,76,890; 5,67,980
Write the number name for 15,67,890

content.introduction: Mastering addition and subtraction of large numbers with carrying and borrowing.

topics.title: Addition with Carrying
topics.description: Adding large numbers when the sum of digits in any place exceeds 9.

topics.title: Subtraction with Borrowing
topics.description: Subtracting when digits in the minuend are smaller than corresponding digits in subtrahend.

exercises: Find the missing number: 56,789 + ___ = 89,234
A farmer had 45,678 kg of rice. He sold 23,456 kg. How much rice is left?

content.introduction: Learning about different types of plants, their parts, and how they grow and survive.

topics.title: Parts of a Plant
topics.description: Understanding the main parts of a plant and their functions.
examples: Roots - absorb water and minerals from soil
Stem - supports the plant and transports water
Leaves - make food through photosynthesis
Flowers - help in reproduction
Fruits - protect seeds and help in dispersal

topics.title: Types of Plants
topics.description: Classification of plants based on their characteristics.
examples: Herbs - small plants with soft stems (tomato, wheat)
Shrubs - medium-sized plants with hard stems (rose, jasmine)
Trees - tall plants with thick woody stems (mango, neem)

exercises: Label the parts of a plant
Name three herbs, three shrubs, and three trees
Why are leaves called the food factory of plants?
Draw and color a flowering plant

content.introduction: Understanding India's geography, diversity, and unity in diversity.

topics.title: Location and Boundaries
topics.description: India's position on the world map and its neighboring countries.
examples: India is located in South Asia
Neighbors: Pakistan, China, Nepal, Bhutan, Bangladesh, Myanmar
Surrounded by Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal, Indian Ocean

topics.title: Unity in Diversity
topics.description: How India has many languages, religions, and cultures but remains united.
examples: Multiple languages spoken across states
Different festivals celebrated
Various food cultures and traditions

exercises: Name the neighboring countries of India
Write about your state and its capital
What does 'Unity in Diversity' mean?
Draw the map of India and mark your state
